issue.title: Bug: `sam local start-lambda` encounters an exception after running the lambda's app code
issue.body:
### Description:
`sam local start-lambda` encounters the following exception after running lambda app code:
```
AttributeError: '_io.StringIO' object has no attribute 'buffer'
```
The application code runs without issue but then `sam` is hitting to the following exception (see traceback below).



### Steps to reproduce:
1. run sam using:  `sam local start-lambda`
1.  invoke the lambda on the local sam instance (in my case I'm using the `RequestResponse` invocation type)



### Observed result:
```
Exception on /2015-03-31/functions/FunctionName/invocations [POST]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/steve/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 2529, in wsgi_app
    response = self.full_dispatch_request()
  File "/home/steve/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1825, in full_dispatch_request
    rv = self.handle_user_exception(e)
  File "/home/steve/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1823, in full_dispatch_request
    rv = self.dispatch_request()
  File "/home/steve/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1799, in dispatch_request
    return self.ensure_sync(self.view_functions[rule.endpoint])(**view_args)
  File "/home/steve/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/samcli/local/lambda_service/local_lambda_invoke_service.py", line 169, in _invoke_request_handler
    self.lambda_runner.invoke(function_name, request_data, stdout=stdout_stream_writer, stderr=self.stderr)
  File "/home/steve/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/samcli/commands/local/lib/local_lambda.py", line 144, in invoke
    self.local_runtime.invoke(
  File "/home/steve/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/samcli/lib/telemetry/metric.py", line 324, in wrapped_func
    return_value = func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/steve/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/samcli/local/lambdafn/runtime.py", line 201, in invoke
    container.wait_for_result(
  File "/home/steve/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/samcli/local/docker/container.py", line 368, in wait_for_result
    stdout.write_bytes(response)
  File "/home/steve/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/samcli/lib/utils/stream_writer.py", line 35, in write_bytes
    self._stream.buffer.write(output)
AttributeError: '_io.StringIO' object has no attribute 'buffer'
2023-10-04 11:42:18 10.99.0.7 - - [04/Oct/2023 11:42:18] "POST /2015-03-31/functions/FunctionName/invocations HTTP/1.1" 500 -
```


### Expected result:
HTTP 200 return code


### Additional environment details (Ex: Windows, Mac, Amazon Linux etc)

```
{
  "version": "1.98.0",
  "system": {
    "python": "3.8.14",
    "os": "Linux-6.1.53-1-MANJARO-x86_64-with-glibc2.34"
  },
  "additional_dependencies": {
    "docker_engine": "24.0.5",
    "aws_cdk": "Not available",
    "terraform": "1.1.6"
  },
  "available_beta_feature_env_vars": [
    "SAM_CLI_BETA_FEATURES",
    "SAM_CLI_BETA_BUILD_PERFORMANCE",
    "SAM_CLI_BETA_TERRAFORM_SUPPORT",
    "SAM_CLI_BETA_RUST_CARGO_LAMBDA"
  ]
}
```

pull_request.title: add --disable-authorizer flag to local start-api
pull_request.body:
#### Which issue(s) does this change fix?
<!-- Use the format #<issue-number>, e.g. #42 -->
This is a possible implementation of #5285. I haven't written unit tests, just need confirmation on go ahead before writing them. Leaving in draft for now :) 

#### Why is this change necessary?
Get past having to generate an auth token everytime I wish to test my api locally. 

#### How does it address the issue?
Add flag and if statements. Ensure the extraction of authorizers is ignored at the parsing level before mounting the local server.

#### What side effects does this change have?
None that I can see.

#### Mandatory Checklist
**PRs will only be reviewed after checklist is complete**

- [x] Add input/output [type hints](https://docs.python.org/3/library/typing.html) to new functions/methods
- [x] Write design document if needed ([Do I need to write a design document?](https://github.com/aws/aws-sam-cli/blob/develop/DEVELOPMENT_GUIDE.md#design-document))
- [x] Write/update unit tests
- [x] Write/update integration tests
- [x] Write/update functional tests if needed
- [x] `make pr` passes
- [x] `make update-reproducible-reqs` if dependencies were changed
- [x] Write documentation

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made under the terms of the [Apache 2.0 license](https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0).

pull_request.body:
Bumps the boto group in /requirements with 5 updates: | Package | From | To | | --- | --- | --- | | [boto3](https://github.com/boto/boto3) | `1.28.69` | `1.28.71` | | [boto3-stubs[apigateway,cloudformation,ecr,iam,kinesis,lambda,s3,schemas,secretsmanager,signer,sqs,stepfunctions,sts,xray]](https://github.com/youtype/mypy_boto3_builder) | `1.28.69` | `1.28.71` | | [botocore](https://github.com/boto/botocore) | `1.31.70` | `1.31.71` | | [botocore-stubs](https://github.com/youtype/botocore-stubs) | `1.31.69` | `1.31.71` | | [mypy-boto3-iam](https://github.com/youtype/mypy_boto3_builder) | `1.28.37` | `1.28.71` | Updates `boto3` from 1.28.69 to 1.28.71
Changelog

Sourced from boto3's changelog.

1.28.71

  • enhancement:Configuration: [botocore] Adds client context params support to Config.
  • api-change:connectcases: [botocore] Increase maximum length of CommentBody to 3000, and increase maximum length of StringValue to 1500
  • api-change:groundstation: [botocore] This release will allow KMS alias names to be used when creating Mission Profiles
  • api-change:iam: [botocore] Updates to GetAccessKeyLastUsed action to replace NoSuchEntity error with AccessDeniedException error.

1.28.70

  • api-change:codepipeline: [botocore] Add ability to trigger pipelines from git tags, define variables at pipeline level and new pipeline type V2.
  • api-change:ec2: [botocore] This release updates the documentation for InstanceInterruptionBehavior and HibernationOptionsRequest to more accurately describe the behavior of these two parameters when using Spot hibernation.
  • api-change:eks: [botocore] Added support for Cluster Subnet and Security Group mutability.
  • api-change:iam: [botocore] Add the partitional endpoint for IAM in iso-f.
  • api-change:migrationhub-config: [botocore] This release introduces DeleteHomeRegionControl API that customers can use to delete the Migration Hub Home Region configuration
  • api-change:migrationhubstrategy: [botocore] This release introduces multi-data-source feature in Migration Hub Strategy Recommendations. This feature now supports vCenter as a data source to fetch inventory in addition to ADS and Import from file workflow that is currently supported with MHSR collector.
  • api-change:opensearchserverless: [botocore] This release includes the following new APIs: CreateLifecyclePolicy, UpdateLifecyclePolicy, BatchGetLifecyclePolicy, DeleteLifecyclePolicy, ListLifecyclePolicies and BatchGetEffectiveLifecyclePolicy to support the data lifecycle management feature.

This feature now supports vCenter as a data source to fetch inventory in addition to ADS and Import from file workflow that is currently supported with MHSR collector.

pull_request.body:
Bumps the boto group in /requirements with 5 updates: | Package | From | To | | --- | --- | --- | | [boto3](https://github.com/boto/boto3) | `1.28.69` | `1.28.72` | | [boto3-stubs[apigateway,cloudformation,ecr,iam,kinesis,lambda,s3,schemas,secretsmanager,signer,sqs,stepfunctions,sts,xray]](https://github.com/youtype/mypy_boto3_builder) | `1.28.69` | `1.28.72` | | [botocore](https://github.com/boto/botocore) | `1.31.70` | `1.31.72` | | [botocore-stubs](https://github.com/youtype/botocore-stubs) | `1.31.69` | `1.31.72` | | [mypy-boto3-iam](https://github.com/youtype/mypy_boto3_builder) | `1.28.37` | `1.28.71` | Updates `boto3` from 1.28.69 to 1.28.72
Changelog

Sourced from boto3's changelog.

1.28.72

  • api-change:appstream: [botocore] This release introduces multi-session fleets, allowing customers to provision more than one user session on a single fleet instance.
  • api-change:ec2: [botocore] Launching GetSecurityGroupsForVpc API. This API gets security groups that can be associated by the AWS account making the request with network interfaces in the specified VPC.
  • api-change:network-firewall: [botocore] Network Firewall now supports inspection of outbound SSL/TLS traffic.
  • api-change:opensearch: [botocore] You can specify ipv4 or dualstack IPAddressType for cluster endpoints. If you specify IPAddressType as dualstack, the new endpoint will be visible under the 'EndpointV2' parameter and will support IPv4 and IPv6 requests. Whereas, the 'Endpoint' will continue to serve IPv4 requests.
  • api-change:redshift: [botocore] Add Redshift APIs GetResourcePolicy, DeleteResourcePolicy, PutResourcePolicy and DescribeInboundIntegrations for the new Amazon Redshift Zero-ETL integration feature, which can be used to control data ingress into Redshift namespace, and view inbound integrations.
  • api-change:sagemaker: [botocore] Amazon Sagemaker Autopilot now supports Text Generation jobs.
  • api-change:sns: [botocore] Message Archiving and Replay is now supported in Amazon SNS for FIFO topics.
  • api-change:ssm-sap: [botocore] AWS Systems Manager for SAP added support for registration and discovery of SAP ABAP applications
  • api-change:transfer: [botocore] No API changes from previous release. This release migrated the model to Smithy keeping all features unchanged.
  • api-change:endpoint-rules: [botocore] Update endpoint-rules client to latest version

1.28.71

  • enhancement:Configuration: [botocore] Adds client context params support to Config.
  • api-change:connectcases: [botocore] Increase maximum length of CommentBody to 3000, and increase maximum length of StringValue to 1500
  • api-change:groundstation: [botocore] This release will allow KMS alias names to be used when creating Mission Profiles
  • api-change:iam: [botocore] Updates to GetAccessKeyLastUsed action to replace NoSuchEntity error with AccessDeniedException error.

1.28.70

  • api-change:codepipeline: [botocore] Add ability to trigger pipelines from git tags, define variables at pipeline level and new pipeline type V2.
  • api-change:ec2: [botocore] This release updates the documentation for InstanceInterruptionBehavior and HibernationOptionsRequest to more accurately describe the behavior of these two parameters when using Spot hibernation.
  • api-change:eks: [botocore] Added support for Cluster Subnet and Security Group mutability.
  • api-change:iam: [botocore] Add the partitional endpoint for IAM in iso-f.
  • api-change:migrationhub-config: [botocore] This release introduces DeleteHomeRegionControl API that customers can use to delete the Migration Hub Home Region configuration
  • api-change:migrationhubstrategy: [botocore] This release introduces multi-data-source feature in Migration Hub Strategy Recommendations. This feature now supports vCenter as a data source to fetch inventory in addition to ADS and Import from file workflow that is currently supported with MHSR collector.
  • api-change:opensearchserverless: [botocore] This release includes the following new APIs: CreateLifecyclePolicy, UpdateLifecyclePolicy, BatchGetLifecyclePolicy, DeleteLifecyclePolicy, ListLifecyclePolicies and BatchGetEffectiveLifecyclePolicy to support the data lifecycle management feature.

pull_request.body:
#### Which issue(s) does this change fix?
<!-- Use the format #<issue-number>, e.g. #42 -->
N/A

#### Why is this change necessary?
This PR updates the windows reproducible dependencies by generating them using python3.11 and updates the windows-binary appveyor config to use python3.11. This allows the installer to be more current with the python version and keep the dependencies in better state.

#### How does it address the issue?
Described above

#### What side effects does this change have?
No side effects

+class TestExtractResourcesWithDisableAuthorizerFlag(TestCase):
+    @parameterized.expand(
+        [
+            ("when enabled doesn't extract authorizer", True),
+            ("when disabled extracts authorizer", False),
+        ]
+    )
+    @patch("samcli.lib.providers.cfn_api_provider.CfnApiProvider._get_route_function_name")
+    def test_extract_resources_apigw_v2_route(self, _, disable_authorizer, mock_get_route_function_name: Mock):
+        template = {
+            "Resources": {
+                "MyRoute": {
+                    "Type": "AWS::ApiGatewayV2::Route",
+                    "Properties": {
+                        "ApiId": "MockApiId",
+                        "AuthorizationType": "CUSTOM",
+                        "RouteKey": "Get /Test",
+                        "Target": "DummyTarget",
+                        "AuthorizerId": "AuthorizerId",
+                        "OperationName": "MockOperation",
+                    },
+                },
+            }
+        }
+        mock_get_route_function_name.return_value = ("Dummy", "Values")
+        provider = CfnApiProvider()
+        mock_collector = Mock()
+        mock_collector.add_routes = Mock()
+        provider._extract_cfn_gateway_v2_route(
+            stack_path="stack_path",
+            resources={},
+            logical_id="MyRoute",
+            route_resource=template["Resources"]["MyRoute"],
+            collector=mock_collector,
+            disable_authorizer=disable_authorizer,
+        )
+
+        if disable_authorizer:
+            route = mock_collector.add_routes.call_args[0][1][0]
+            assert route.authorizer_name is None
+
+        if not disable_authorizer:
+            mock_collector.add_routes.assert_called()
+            route = mock_collector.add_routes.call_args[0][1][0]
+            assert route.authorizer_name is "AuthorizerId"

pull_request.title: add --disable-authorizer flag to local start-api
pull_request.body:
#### Which issue(s) does this change fix?
<!-- Use the format #<issue-number>, e.g. #42 -->
This is a possible implementation of #5285. I haven't written unit tests, just need confirmation on go ahead before writing them. Leaving in draft for now :) 

#### Why is this change necessary?
Get past having to generate an auth token everytime I wish to test my api locally. 

#### How does it address the issue?
Add flag and if statements. Ensure the extraction of authorizers is ignored at the parsing level before mounting the local server.

#### What side effects does this change have?
None that I can see.

pull_request.title: add --disable-authorizer flag to local start-api
pull_request.body:
#### Which issue(s) does this change fix?
<!-- Use the format #<issue-number>, e.g. #42 -->
This is a possible implementation of #5285. I haven't written unit tests, just need confirmation on go ahead before writing them. Leaving in draft for now :) 

#### Why is this change necessary?
Get past having to generate an auth token everytime I wish to test my api locally. 

#### How does it address the issue?
Add flag and if statements. Ensure the extraction of authorizers is ignored at the parsing level before mounting the local server.

#### What side effects does this change have?
None that I can see.
